an5.52:4.1: “Mendicants, rightly speaking, you’d call the five hindrances a ‘heap of the unwholesome’.
an5.52:4.2: For these five hindrances are entirely a heap of the unwholesome.
an5.52:4.4: The hindrances of sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
an5.52:4.5: Rightly speaking, you’d call these five hindrances a ‘heap of the unwholesome’.
an5.52:4.6: For these five hindrances are entirely a heap of the unwholesome.”
